oai_dc:dc.dc:title: US Martingale plate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Brass heart shaped martingale plate with US in the center. Recovered from Murfreesboro, Rutherford County (Tenn." item is lead filled. The martingale plate decorated the center of the breast strap. The breast strap extended from each side of the saddle and went across the breast of the horse. The purpose of the breast strap was to prevent the saddle from sliding backward. It was common for these straps to be adorned with brass hearts with an eagle or a regimental number or US for United States.
